New Records: India spinners took six wickets to turn the match against Australia at the ICC Men's Cricket World Cup 2023
Key Match Events: Ravindra Jadeja ran through the Australia middle-order with three crucial wickets
Virat Kohli and KL Rahul combined for a 165-run stand for the fourth wicket
Post-Match Reflections: Ravindra Jadeja identified the turning point in India's triumph over Australia as his wicket of Steve Smith
Jadeja revealed that MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai was not as helpful to the spinners as he initially expected
Miscellaneous Highlights: India skittled Australia out for 199 on a wicket that ultimately proved to be conducive to spin
India take on Afghanistan next in their World Cup fixture in Delhi on Wednesday before the marquee clash against Pakistan in Ahmedabad on October 14
Others: The match was played at the ICC Men's Cricket World Cup 2023 in Chennai
